page.title: 04Afton Farm - Berry Pomeroy
page.content: Afton Farm belongs to the Duke of Somerset, but Mr and Mrs Moule rent it. They have many animals such as South Devon Cattle, Cornwall and Devon Longwool Sheep anf Highland Sussex chickens. The land is worth approximately half a million pounds. Some of the land is used for growing crops such as wheat, mangolds, swedes, cabbages and potatoes. Mr and Mrs Moule also make their own milk and cream which they sell to passers-by. The chickens lay between 1 and 5 eggs per week, these eggs are free range. The machines in use on the farm cost around Â£6000 each. They cannot be very large because the lanes which lead to the fields are too narrow.
